segment.source: Installation Files Page
segment.target: Installation Files Page

segment.source: Installation Files Page
segment.target: Installation Files Page

segment.source: Installation Files Page
segment.target: Installation Files Page

segment.source: Use the Installation Files page to specify the installation files that were used to create the virtual application package specified on the Select Package page of this wizard.
segment.target: Use the Installation Files page to specify the installation files that were used to create the virtual application package specified on the Select Package page of this wizard.

segment.source: If you created a virtual application package that contains multiple applications, you should copy all required installation files to a single folder on the computer running the Microsoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.
segment.target: If you created a virtual application package that contains multiple applications, you should copy all required installation files to a single folder on the computer running the Microsoft Application Virtualization Sequencer.

segment.source: This page contains the following elements:
segment.target: This page contains the following elements:

segment.source: Original Installation Files
segment.target: Original Installation Files

segment.source: Click Browse to specify the installation files that were originally used to create the virtual application package.
segment.target: Click Browse to specify the installation files that were originally used to create the virtual application package.

segment.source: The parent directory you specify should be saved locally to the computer running the Sequencer and must contain all required installation files or subfolders that contain the installation files.
segment.target: The parent directory you specify should be saved locally to the computer running the Sequencer and must contain all required installation files or subfolders that contain the installation files.

segment.source: The installation files can be contained in the parent folder or in any of the subfolders of the specified parent folder.
segment.target: The installation files can be contained in the parent folder or in any of the subfolders of the specified parent folder.

segment.source: Files installed on local system
segment.target: Files installed on local system

segment.source: Click Browse to specify the installation files that have been installed locally on the computer running the Sequencer.
segment.target: Click Browse to specify the installation files that have been installed locally on the computer running the Sequencer.

segment.source: You can only select this option if the application installation files have been installed to the application’s default location.
segment.target: You can only select this option if the application installation files have been installed to the application’s default location.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The default installation location you provide depends on the following conditions:
segment.target: The default installation location you provide depends on the following conditions:

segment.source: The package root specified when the package was originally created.
segment.target: The package root specified when the package was originally created.

segment.source: The installation location specified in the Windows Installer when the package was originally created.
segment.target: The installation location specified in the Windows Installer when the package was originally created.

segment.source: The default application installation path.
segment.target: The default application installation path.

segment.source: For example, if the package root specified is Q:Office12 and during installation, the default installation location is changed from C:Program FilesOffice12 to Q:Office12, then the path specified during dehydration must be C:Program FilesOffice 12.
segment.target: For example, if the package root specified is Q:Office12 and during installation, the default installation location is changed from C:Program FilesOffice12 to Q:Office12, then the path specified during dehydration must be C:Program FilesOffice 12.

segment.source: If the package root specified is Q:Microsoft and during installation, the default installation location is changed from C:Program FilesOffice12 to Q:MicrosoftOffice12, then the path specified during dehydration must be C:Program Files.
segment.target: If the package root specified is Q:Microsoft and during installation, the default installation location is changed from C:Program FilesOffice12 to Q:MicrosoftOffice12, then the path specified during dehydration must be C:Program Files.

segment.source: When you create a package using a package accelerator, each file in the package, for example Q:Office12file.txt is found on the local computer by replacing the package root Q:Office12 with the default location specified when the Package Accelerator was created, for example, C:Program FilesOffice12.
segment.target: When you create a package using a package accelerator, each file in the package, for example Q:Office12file.txt is found on the local computer by replacing the package root Q:Office12 with the default location specified when the Package Accelerator was created, for example, C:Program FilesOffice12.

segment.source: In the previous example, the file should be located in C:Program FilesOffice12file.txt.
segment.target: In the previous example, the file should be located in C:Program FilesOffice12file.txt.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Create Package Accelerator Wizard (AppV 4.6 SP1)
